It seems ksp doesn't recognize Singularity's dll file. You can try to reinstall it. For the gas giant issue, since there isn't any related error showed up in your log, my suggestion is trying a clean installation with Kcalbeloh and its dependencies only to see whether it is caused by mod conflicts.

Hello everybody!
I've playing Kcalbeloh System for a week now, and found some issues. Not sure if someone already reported this, but after try to land on multiple planets, the ground is kinda buggy and wheels get stucked in the ground, destroying the ship when landing/takeoff. Kerbals also get detroyed to the ground if they simply jump. This also happens when deploy surface experiments, wich i saw someone else did it without issues so, if nobody else report this i could provide the log file, thx in advance

Some images of my adventures on Sera!
 

Spoiler

Hello everybody!
I've playing Kcalbeloh System for a week now, and found some issues. Not sure if someone already reported this, but after try to land on multiple planets, the ground is kinda buggy and wheels get stucked in the ground, destroying the ship when landing/takeoff. Kerbals also get detroyed to the ground if they simply jump. This also happens when deploy surface experiments, wich i saw someone else did it without issues so, if nobody else report this i could provide the log file, thx in advance

Some images of my adventures on Sera!
 

  Reveal hidden contents

 

you can check whether you have enabled one of the kopernicus settings to fix the issue. Or you can just download the newest version of kopernicus. the fix is on by default in newest kopernicus version.

13 hours ago, Jason Kerman said:

could you try to remove the following dlls? 666_ModuleManagerWatchDog.dll, 999_Scale_Redist.dll, KSPModFileLocalizer.dll

done, the two planets are still broken somehow Log: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1spQLxetRXzFgIkEeti-udnQRBhWJNAcf/view?usp=sharing

Also, a few other bugs i've seen:

When the atmospheric heating on ascent during launch starts turning orange, so does the surface so does the ocean of Efil with it. This is just a visual bug though, and it only does this every once in a while

When timewarping in the tracking station, Efil visibly deviates from its orbit and can go out as far as Eulb or Elad. Might not be visual only, i've seen asteroids that spawn in Anehta's orbit and even a satellite be flung out of their orbits when normally they're perfectly stable and don't cross and SOI's. Just letting you know if you didn't already

Edited May 26, 2023 by Souptime

Yes, there are some visual bugs when enableing homeswitch, like launch site icons floating and drifting, and the home planet out of place when time warping. They are not fixable by me, but hopefully by Kopernicus in the future. 

For the gas giant texture issue, I still didn't see any related errors in the log and I'm not able to reproduce it at the moment. But I will keep it in mind.

Thank you anyway for your report!

No problem, good luck with the mod!

Update v1.0.4-alpha

Available on GitHub (pre-release).

This is an alpha release, which means some features are still working-in-progress and unfinished. Bugs might exist.

Changes since v1.0.3-alpha:

  1. Parallax 2.0 scatters added.
  2. More science definitions added.
  3. Reduced the radius of Norihc.
  4. Adjusted the altitude threshold of flying low/high and in space low/high and the altitude of time warp limit for some planets.
  5. Fixed Arorua's atmosphere curve.
  6. Fixed the error that Rouqea's atmosphere was not oxygenated in the last version. Fixed the error that Uleg's atmosphere was oxygenated in the last version.
  7. Adjusted the biome list of Suluco.
  8. Fixed Kerbol's light intensity curve under rescaling.
  9. Added built-in settings for KSP Community Fixes to force disable the stock maneuver planning tool.
  10. Added resource config for MetalOre used by Extraplanetary Launchpads.
  11. Fixed the popped-up Module Manager errors with RSS.
  12. Fixed the error that Rouqea has small pieces of land. Adjusted Rouqea's wave to be bigger.
  13. Added support for Rational Resources, but the config is in RR's downloads.

Other changes since v1.0.1:

  1. Orbit adjustments:
    (1) Simetra-Simeht system
    - Move the binary gas giants closer to each other.
    - Move Noira to retrograde orbit around the barycenter.
    - Move Noi to L4 Lagrange Point of Sunorc.
    - Adjust the SMA of Norihc and Noyreg.
    - Increase the SMA of the barycenter for a bit.
    (2) Increase the SMA of Maelg, Sunorc, and Aralc system for orbit stability.
    (3) Move Aralc-A and Aralc-B closer to each other.
    (4) Adjust the SMA of Ahtpan, Tot, and Sera.
    (5) Increase the inclination of Meiuqer.
  2. Better implementation for HomeSwitch and other settings.
  3. [WIP] Add support for Principia. The system stability has been tested for more than 500 years. Only works WITHOUT homeSwitch.
  4. Add support for ResearchBodies.
  5. Add support for Parallax under Homeswitch settings.
  6. Other minor changes/fixes:
    • Increase the atmosphere height of Rouqea.
    • Better sunlight curve for RSS.
    • Better planet introduction writing.
    • Remove the sunlight requirement for ScanSat since it only recognizes Kerbol as light source.
    • The wormhole will orbit Sarnus if OPM is installed.
    • Fix the timewarp limits in low-Kcalbeloh orbit.
    • Fix the accretion disk invisible in Linux/Mac.
    • Fix the orientations for tidally locked planets with RSS installed.
    • Remove RunSharp.dll in bundled KopernicusExpansions since it's useless and can cause issues.

Thanks for the update!

23 hours ago, Jason Kerman said:

Added resource config for MetalOre used by Extraplanetary Launchpads.

Do you know if this will affect the optional RR patch? I'm using RationalResourcesELUtilities which converts the EL MetalOre to the CRP version.

https://github.com/JadeOfMaar/RationalResources/tree/master/Extras/RationalResourcesELUtilities

@UltraJohn (Short answer: There's no effect.) Actually it appears that there is no MetalOre config (so whatever MetalOre shows up is fully random as default). There's a MetallicOre config but on its own EL has no business with it. This mod's bundled resource placement configs don't seem to have tags in them (such that RR would leave them alone and conflict with them) so that's good news.
